intro: Argostemma uniflorum, commonly known as the single-flower argostemma, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial with slender, climbing stems. Its flowers are small, white or pale yellow, and are clustered in umbels. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
